main event: On August 25, 1951, three individuals in Lubbock, Texas observed a formation of unidentified flying objects that were bright lights moving in a generally southwesterly direction.
interesting points: The objects were reported to consist of 12 to 30 individual lights, moving at an altitude between 1,000 to 2,000 feet., They appeared white or yellow-white in color and were round in shape., The formation was first seen moving rapidly before slowing down to a steady pace., No sound was heard during the observation., The objects disappeared from view when they moved behind a cloud bank.
witness description: two civilian and one Air Force officer
